topic.title: REFCLK Termination

body.p: The following diagrams represent the REFCLK recommended termination schemes.

note.p: All circuits below assume a 2pF output load

example.title: DC Coupled termination of REFCLK fed by an external server board or clock buffer using HCSL (HCSL-to-LVDS termination)
DC Coupled termination of REFCLK fed by an external server board or clock buffer using LVDS (LVDS-to-LVDS termination)
DC Coupled termination of REFCLK fed by an external server board or clock buffer using LVPECL (LVPECL-to-LVDS termination)

table.title: REFCLK specifications for DC Coupled case

entry.p: Absolute min/max voltages allowed at the Rx pins

body.p: Please note that if the REFCLK pins are not AC coupled, clock input should not be supplied to the pins until the device is powered.

example.title: AC Coupled termination of REFCLK fed by an external server board or clock buffer using HCSL, LVPECL or LVDS (HCSL/LVPECL/LVDS-to-LVDS termination)
example.p: Place the 100-ohm resistor near the receiver side.

table.title: REFCLK specifications for AC Coupled Input Case

entry.p: Input Differential Voltage. The Receiver is self-biased and external biasing is not required in case of AC coupling. The signal swings given here assume no external biasing is used

example.title: AC Coupled termination of REFCLK outputs (REFCLK_S) using LVDS feeding an HCSL receiver (LVDS to HCSL termination)

note.p: Set RT to 2.2kΩ for PCIe Cards with termination1
Set RT to 50Ω for PCIe Cards without termination2

table.title: REFCLK specifications for AC Coupled Output Case

topic.title: Reference Clock Timing

note.p: Sourced from PMC-2143425 - Saratoga Device Specification Issue 11

section.title: PCI Express PCIE_REFCLK_D/PCIE_REFCLK_H
section.p: Microsemi recommends a low jitter, clean clock source for PCIE_REFCLK_D1 and PCIE_REFCLK_H in order to provide optimal signal integrity performance. A PCIe Base Specification 4.0 compliant clock source is required as an input to PCIE_REFCLK_H2. The recommended input clock for PCIE_REFCLK_D and PCIE_REFCLK_H is provided in Table 5.

row.entry: Total narrowband jitter on REFCLK (after applying Gen4 Jitter filter mask as per PCIe Base Spec)
Frequency lock after device reset pin RSTB is de-asserted with REFCLK

note.p: 1 If PCIE_REFCLK_D/PCIE_REFCLK_H is used to source the output PCIE_REFCLK_S, MSCC recommends a TREFIN maximum value of 0.3 ps-rms (after applying Gen4 Jitter filter mask as per PCIe Base Spec 4.0)MSDG: I think the safe approach for now is to leave margin between a general input refclk spec (0.5 ps,rms) and a tighter input refclk spec (0.3 ps,rms) when Tx output provides the refclks. We can then revisit/tweak this based on new silicon results.

table.title: List of validated MSCC Clock Devices for use with Switchtec

entry.p: Four Frequency Family High Performance Frequency Synthesizer and Rate Convertor with 6-Outputs

note.p: The components listed in Table 6 complies with the specification requirements outlined in Table 5

section.title: PCI Express PCIE_REFCLK_S* Output Characteristics
section.p: Switchtec PCIE_REFCLK_S* clock outputs are fully PCIe Base Specification 4.0 compliant as long as the guidance in Table 5 is followed.
